data.title: This is a great place to stop and have an old fashioned hamburger.
data.text: This is a great place to stop and have a hamburger if your not in a hurry. It is in old Town Odessa, Texas which is in Ector County. The parking is not very good since it is downtown so go very early. You can always park around the corner block and walk.  It's not that far and it's well worth the trip.

data.title: Great Burgers
data.text: Needed A quick lunch and had to hit the road. Came across Permian basin Hamburger co and gave it A try. Grabbed A chili Cheeseburger and fries . All was delicious , good service great food. Will have to stop by next time in the area.

data.title: Great  Burgers
data.text: This place makes great burgers but where it's located (downtown) there is not enough parking.  For people that work nearby it's very convenient.

data.title: Best Chili Cheese Burger in the World
data.text: You can get it plain, you can get it with cheese, but your missing the boat if you skip the chili. Best combination Chili Cheese burger ever. Don't forget to help yourself to the fries, they are fresh cut and salty. Super lunch experience.

data.title: Underwhelmed
data.text: Service was marginal.  Standard burger with few options.  Burger was fine, but nothing exceptional about it.  It's your typical downtown greasy spoon burger joint.

data.title: burgers
data.text: burger was cold, fries were awesome service was great burger wasn't exciting as i expected wasn't what i was told

data.title: The best burgers in West Texas!
data.text: These are by far the very best homemade burgers in all of West Texas.  The grated cheese is such a perfect tough.  The fries are so good and the atmosphere is perfect. We ALWAYS eat here during the Christmas parade and are always very satisfied.  The staff is so friendly, even when they have a full house and the line is out the front door. If you are looking for a great burger for lunch, this is the best place in Odessa.

data.title: Fantastic Chili burger
data.text: I just stumbled upon this great burger place in downtown Odessa. Cars were parked everywhere so thought I'd give it a try. I met a local coming out as I was going in, so asked his opinion. He said it was great and to get the chili burger, it's what they are known for. I did and he was right. You order at the counter and it's handed to you promptly. You then help yourself to all the pinto beans and homemade fries you can pile on your plate.  I must go back and try another burger.

data.title: friendly and comfortable
data.text: The proprietor is the man that is slapping the burgers on the plate for you.  He is a heck of a nice guy, he is always in a good mood.  He will tell you his story if you have time to stand there.  The food is good and is always consistent.  He is not open for dinner and closes at 2pm every week day.

data.title: Hamburger Co.
data.text:
Love this place. The best Chili cheese and onion burger in this town. And home cut fries and their own beans. Can not beat it.
They are only open to 2pm

data.title: Nothing fancy, but great burgers
data.text: Don't blink or  you will miss this great little hamburger joint in downtown Odessa.  It isn't anything fancy, but the service is small town friendly, the burgers are great as are the hand cut fries and pinto beans.  They are only open for lunch, so don't show up for dinner.

data.title: Jammed Packed
data.text: Get there early for lunch. You'll probably stand in line but promise it's worth the wait. One of the best hamburgers around.

data.title: Great Place to eat
data.text: This is a Great place to eat. It is hard finding parking since it is downtown.. It is only open during Lunch. It does stay busy most days.

data.title: Ho Hum..
data.text: My burger was a bit on the raw side. The upside is that is quick and efficient! The french fries are great as they are not processed fries, but cut from real potatos.  The atmosphere is about par for an older downtown Odessa restaurant setting.

data.title: Greatest Hamburgers in Town
data.text: Been there for 20+ years for a reason.  Fast service, great French fries (handcut and freshly cooked in clean oil), and delicious chili-burgers.

data.title: Best hamburgers in the Basin
data.text: This without a doubt is the best Hamburgers in Odessa. They are tasty and with Pinto Beans and home made French Fries it is a great meal. My favorite is the Chili Cheese with lots of beans and fries. You can't go wrong eating a The Permian Basin hamburger Company!!

data.title: Best Hamberger place downtown
data.text: The BEST Chili Cheese burger in town, and home cut fries .Also  they cook their own beans. They are open only until 2pm. Monday thru Fridays. If you come to Odessa you need to try this place. on Grant street, downtown.

data.title: Yummy
data.text: Got a gift card as a Mother's Day Gift so I took my kiddos, ages 2 & 9. Food was very good and the service was great. The décor is fun too!

data.title: Hamburgers
data.text: Excellent place for really good hamburgers.  Several varieties to choose from.  Plain, with cheese, chili, bacon, or hickory, to name a few.  Opened for lunch only.

data.title: More to Be Desired
data.text: My co-workers and I visited for lunch. First, I am not use to paying more than $10 for a burger. But since the restaurant came highly recommended, I thought I'd give it a try. The guy making the burgers was okay, but had a condensing remark towards my co-worker. Then, the cashier did not speak and threw my receipt down in front of me. I started to let her know of her unprofessional actions, but remembered I'd get more satisfaction by bringing my comments here. The food was decent, but I am in no hurry to return.
